website_summaries.verdict: This classic scissor lift design is a stellar choice for motorcycles with flat bottoms.
pros: If you have a small to medium-sized motorcycle with a flat bottom, OrionMotorTech’s scissor lift might be for you
Its steel frame can handle vehicles up to 1,000 pounds, and it has a lift range of 3.75-13.4 inches
This crank handle is very simple to use and the unit folds down to a compact size for effortless storage
cons: Not suitable for dirt bikes, ATVs, UTVs, or snowmobiles
A small number of users have reported threads stripping

customer_reviews.title: Works great,
customer_reviews.text: It works great once you understand that the taller/higher you crank it up the more wobbly anything gets. Plus the air fins on the bottom of the motor rips up the rubber on the top of the lift. I put a 2x8 piece of wood on top which keeps the lift lower and more solid. Remember you only need the tire a 1/4 inch off the ground to be able to turn it the wheel. There is no need to raise the bike a foot off the ground like I have seen people do.
customer_reviews.author: NWA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I need. If you're looking for hydraulic and bulky, this ain't it. If you're lifting to clean, adjust wheel alignment or general whatnotness, this is your lift. Crank mechanism is small but I just use a 22mm socket on extension and I'm in the air. I knew I'd use the socket going in as well as having to use shim blocks because of the oil pan design on my 750 shadow ACE.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE

customer_reviews.title: I like this
customer_reviews.text: First when you open the box be sure and find the crank handle. I nearly threw the box out as the handle is wrapped up and not really noticeable in all the packing. Otherwise i like it a lot. It seems to be a sturdy unit. One issue is if you have a drain screw located under the motor you will not be able to access it if you use this for changing oil. Mine is on the side so it is not an issue. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with my 1987 Heritage Softail
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with my 1987 Heritage Softail! I used a ratchet and socket which is much easier, lifted the bike easily and safely so I could work on the front forks and wheel! I like the low height when it is closed which makes it easy to get under my low bike. That is the main reason I went with a scissor jack versus a hydraulic version on wheels - too high to get under. I didn't lift it very high but it seemed very study and the bike was planted on the jack.
customer_reviews.author: Jake C6R

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I use it to jack up my Harley Street Glide (about 800 lbs) while elevated on my motorcycle lift. It can be used fine on the ground/floor also. I added grease to the screw just in case.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: TWO YEAR LOVE AFFAIR
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in July 2018. I immediately extended it fully so I could apply a thin film of axle grease to every point of friction or wear. I keep it well greased, too. > My heaviest bike is about 675 lbs. and that's the heaviest load I've lifted. A hi-torque drill motor will power it pretty well, as will a hand held wrench. > I've also used it in other ways around the home, and it's never let me down. This is certainly one of the best tool buys I've ever made. > According to a study by the Institute of Incomplete Information, 9 out of every 10 people.
customer_reviews.author: GLB

customer_reviews.title: My lift failed after a few uses. The seller refunded my purchase. Noteworthy customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I used this stand 4 to 5 times. The last time, the stand was raised to maximum height. Once the lift was fully extended, it would not adjust downward as designed. Instead it was locked out for all intents and purposes. I used a breaker bar and socket in a last ditch attempt to restore the downward motion and the screw bolt broke. UPDATE: The after reaching out to the seller with the explanation with the failed lift, the Seller offered to refund the purchase which I gladly accepted. I am pleased with their commitment to customer service. I cannot give the lift a higher rating because of the early failure; however, the customer service is 5-star worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Not just for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me with replacing the garbage disposal under my sink. I have replaced enough of those over the years to know there had to be a better way replace them. This is small enough and light enough to get under the sink. It did not have quite enough reach to get to the disposal, but stacking a few extra 2x4's took care of that. Using this made replacing my disposal a very trivial operation. No doubt I will find other situations where this can be used hold things up for me.
customer_reviews.author: nomad123

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Jacked up my bike to remove both wheels on Friday. Didn't get the tires replaced and until Monday. Reinstalled them on Tuesday evening. Just to check it out, I measured the height of my bike when I removed the wheels and again when I put them back on. The jack didn't go down a bit in 4 days. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: David Hines

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it 3 times since I got it almost 5 months ago. The frame does cut into the rubber a little bit, but what will 500lbs of anything do to rubber. It lifts up smoothly and the bike stays balanced while wrenching. I have yet to change oil on it yet, but i imagine if its in the way a little, a bit of imagination can get the job done. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Collins

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little lift, decent price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to lift my HD Ultra Limited while replacing the front forks. Left it up on the jack for two days with absolutely no issues! If placed under the bike properly it was very sturdy and I had no worries of it tipping over. I used it in a manner to only lift the front up so that it was a little more sturdy. Wouldn't lift the entire bike off the ground unless you have a way to tether it securily. Would recommend to friends and buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: BTARBOX

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I got this to do some work on my motorcycle, and it's perfect. I have a Road King Classic, so it's pretty big, about 650lbs, and I was able to lift it alone. I do recommend using a longer bolt, or even a long handled screw driver.
customer_reviews.author: Bresue

customer_reviews.title: Not Built Well
customer_reviews.text: If you go to lower your bike and unscrew a little too far the bearing race loosens and the bearings fall out of the race. There should be a stop on the adjuster bolt to keep it from backing out too far so this doesn't happen. In other words ounce the jack is at its lowest point the adjuster bolt should stop, not just keep screwing till it falls out of the jack.
customer_reviews.author: cohansl

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my 85 Soft tail
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 85 Soft tail.... great for cleaning wheels and maintenance...I only raise it so I can comfortably work on it sitting on my HF adjustable stool...No complaints here...I can install it myself by straightening the bike up and ( having the jack prepositioned ) slide it under with my foot on a concrete garage floor....You have to pay attention to the balance point and I use a 22 mm socket and long ratchet....Slick....
customer_reviews.author: brushstomper

customer_reviews.title: This Jack Lifted my GL1800 by itself.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jack for stability. I used it to hold the bike up so I could rebuild the front end, as you can see in the picture. I needed to lift the Goldwing so that I could get it up on the center stand on the motorcycle lift. This jack is rated at 1000 lbs., my Goldwing weighs 892 lbs., and it lifted it. This jack did what I bought it for, based on comparison to other similar jacks the price was good and the general ratings seemed better. If you want a nice scissor jack with a decent surface area for stability this should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Assure you bike weight is centered
customer_reviews.text: Good jack , low profile, plenty of lift , early to move around. Although the crank T- socket is a joke. I used a 1/2 drive with a 7/8 socket..
customer_reviews.author: George Akens IV.

customer_reviews.title: It Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for me. I took one star away because it was a little cumbersome. You do have to crank one turn at a time because the lever comes in two long pieces, one that fits into lift and the other goes perpendicular to the first metal that you turn the first with. Otherwise, it did work well. It lifted my motorcycle of the ground in about 20-25 turns.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart @ FFX-LRV

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but need to lube before use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Mostly using it to get the front end up high enough for a tire change. Back half is on a temp center stand. I will give one word of advice. Before you use it, grease the threads and put a few drops of oil on the pivots. Mine was bone dry! Moving parts need to be lubricated, especially under such force.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Private

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty good.  Compact and easy to store/carry
customer_reviews.text: It does the job and is small and compact. It should, in my opinion, but about $50. It would use some additionally stabilization, given how narrow it is, and I don't really like the hand crank. I used a ratchet to turn the knob, which works pretty well. You could also use a driver with the correct socket to zip it up and down quickly. BEST FEATURE, it's super compact and easy to haul/store.
customer_reviews.author: MW149

customer_reviews.title: Threads stripped/jack frozen after being used a single time
customer_reviews.text: Jack will not raise or lower my motorcycle (have used only once). Appears that threads are stripped (and/or jack frozen in place). Motorcycle weighs approximately 500 pounds. Cannot lower my bike, so unable to move bike until spring. Then will use jack as a boat anchor. Read other reviews about stripped threads. Unsure how I am going to lower my bike in the spring with out 3-4 people helping me lift it off jack
customer_reviews.author: Tinley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for supporting bike while working on wheels
customer_reviews.text: I don't plan on lifting my bike, or anything else, with this jack. I've started replacing tires on my own and having a jack like this took a great deal of frustration of trying to balance a wheel on a 3" diameter surface of a small jack and pieces of 2x6's. You can get the wheel ito the correct height then roll the wheel forward and backward to get the axle in the right position easily. As mentioned in other reviews I use a 7/8" socket on LOW speed to raise and lower the jack. I used the handle that came with the jack to raise and lower the jack slightly to the correct height. This is a back saver!
customer_reviews.author: Walks35

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I chose this over the much more expensive hydraulic ones. I have a pretty heavy bike and this lifts it no problem, and it's pretty stable all the way up. Plus when collapsed it is pretty small and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack Stand for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This jack stand is perfect for the minor motorcycle work I do. No problem lifting and balancing a 2014 H-D Dyna. Used to change fork springs & rear shocks, as well as other repairs. I'm sure it would work well for a small camper, car, atv, or lawnmower. Perfectly designed for its intended use. Does not take up much space, and functions perfectly. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous jack
customer_reviews.text: First use, it went up smoothly however while lowering it, the ratchet snapped and the jack collapsed in on itself, bike slammed into the ground hard luckily I had the bike strapped with ratchet straps and no damage was done to me or the bike although the bike would’ve fell right on top of me if those straps weren't there to bounce it back to the side with the kick stand. I would be very weary if you plan on buying this jack
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’m rating it 5 stars but my experience was okay. For context, I own a 2003 Honda Shadow vt600 AKA VLX. This bike is water cooled and has a pipe that runs a little lower than the frame. So using this on the bike is a little dicey. Not the products fault. Otherwise I believe this would have worked amazingly. I did orient it in a position where it’d work for me but not the most ideal situation since a mere tap on the bike would cause it to wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Rangel

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I have a vintage BMW that can be very hard to get onto the center stand. This jack is well-made and strong, and it fits perfectly under the oil pan. Once raised, it provides a very secure perch for the bike. Just for raising and lowering the bike, I keep a 7/8" deep socket and inexpensive ratchet on a nearby shelf. I prefer this to the stubby tool that comes with the jack.
customer_reviews.author: Barbon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little hoist!! Worked great! Reliable. Steady. Worth the price. It jacked my ‘92 HD with no problem. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Wood

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BIY THIS PEACE OF CRAP!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this one time and it broke.I took it out of the box and put it under my 883 so I could replace the drive belt. When I was finished I tried to bring the jack down and it wouldn't come down so after trying everything to loosen the obviously binded threads the end of the bolt broke off sending my bike crashing to the ground. Good thing my kickstand was down otherwise my bike would of been falling over because this jack couldn't go down even once!
customer_reviews.author: Saffels

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for low profile motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Don't often write reviews, but this merited it. This low profile jack fit underneath my 2003 Honda VTX1300S Easily, and I was able to maneuver it with my foot while steadying the bike, and then used a large ratchet to get it level on the jack. I was able to take it up as high as I wanted to access my filter and the two oil pan screws.... I may use an air ratchet next time just to make it a bit easier and safer, and if I could do this with a foot operated air control this would really be the bomb!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Scott Davenport II

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last you long.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one and it does the same thing. The long screw strips after about two months of use. It’s beyond frustrating. Works great while it’s works and one day it will just go. Luckily I have another one. Try a different brand. I use it from Harley Davidson’s down time little bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Dragana

customer_reviews.title: Jack
customer_reviews.text: Jack worked well the first 4 or 5 times I used it. As I was lowering the last time the threads completely striped out dropping the bike the last 2 inches or so. Luckily the kickstand caught, and kept the bike from falling over. The steel in the threaded block is soft. I greased the threads, and joints with white lithium before I ever used it, and it stripped anyway. It might be ok for small motorcycles, but not a 850 pound Harley.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Maloy

customer_reviews.title: Scary. But it works.
customer_reviews.text: Scares the hell out of me every time I use the thing. It's not super sturdy, but once you get the bike centered, it works. Gets the wheels up for chain maintenance or even winter storage. For that, I guess I would recommend it. Side stand down, start cranking the jack and the bike reluctantly finds center. It's butt-puckering, but it works. You'll want another set of hands for stabilization. Do not use if: a) your kids run around in your garage and could bump it. b) a strong wind is present
customer_reviews.author: Marshall H.

customer_reviews.title: Functions as advertised and so far seems fairly sturdy. I put my 2016 Ultra Classic up on ...
customer_reviews.text: Functions as advertised and so far seems fairly sturdy. I put my 2016 Ultra Classic up on it to store for the winter and so far it's working well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thursby

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: impressed with this jack! easy to lift my bike (460lbs) with the provided wrench and is very stable. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: This little scissor jack appears to be well made and is heavy duty. It is a bit heavier than what I thought it would be, which is a pro for me! I use this on a HF motorcycle lift that has wings added to use it for atvs. This jack will be used on the lift table to raise lower the atv to remove tires, place jack stands, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Steven M

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It’s platform is very large it will hold the bike but you will need to have bike tied down some who if you plan on doing a lot on work but if you have a lift and use this to take off tires or hold an engine it works great
customer_reviews.author: Jaxdp

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to take the weight off of a new set of tires while my bike is put up for the winter. It has sat on this thing for three months and I have only had to adjust it once. It is propping up a 2010 Harley Sportster Iron 883.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Little thick for lowered bikes, but it's fine!
customer_reviews.text: Packaged very well, nice and sturdy. Used it for my HD Softail the day I got it. If you have a lowered bike like mine, it may not slide under your bike. Mine was too low, so I had to raise the bike using air ride suspension. If you don't have that, riding over a 2x4 or small wook block will give you clearance to stick it under. It keeps it steady and easy to lift the scissors with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: MI Intl

customer_reviews.title: Own a Motorcycle This is a Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it wouldn’t be as sturdy and heavy duty but I was wrong! This is a must have not only do I use this during oil changes but I use it as a kickstand’s assistant Yes I still use the kick stand but I use this to relieve some of the pressure off of the kickstand this is a excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it does. The price is right. It lifts the bike, and doesn't require breaking anything on my body to do so. It lifted my Honda VTX 1800 (705lb curb weight) right up with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for my Iron
customer_reviews.text: Jack was shipped and arrived quickly. The jack does actually what it was designed to do. Just think of this as a compact comparable scissors car jack versus full size floor jack, not something to be used for longer term or heavy duty projects or work. Lifts my Harley Iron just fine for minor repairs and maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great price works as needed. I have a vtx1800 very heavy bike and this lift handles it no problem. Can lift it with one person but I recommend two when lowering it, you could do it by yourself just not as secure.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Solid well made
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says, with ease, This has paid for itself over and over, allowing me to work on my bike in ways I wouldn't have been able to if I didn't have it. It is well made, solid and heavy. Jacks up with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I use this scissor lift jack as a replacement for my broken drill press table assembly. It works perfectly and it saved me a bundle on a new or used part that has been impossible to find. Not sure how it would work to raise a motorcycle, but it seems like it would do that really well, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy. To get the jack in a functional position I set it on a cinder block or a block of wood. If you jack it from the ground to full extension it is too short for jacking up my tall dirt bike.
customer_reviews.author: JimTid

customer_reviews.title: Not low enough for a FXDL
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use when I need to lift my FXDL up when it was on the motorcycle lift so I could pull the rear wheel. But it is about 3/4 of an inch to tall when completely compressed. My 02 FXDL still has factory height shocks so I figured this would fit under the rear section of the frame, but it does not.
customer_reviews.author: Lobo

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy jack. I don't think I would fully extend it, it is unstable at that height. Half way is very stable with my V-Rod on it and you only lose a couple of inches in height. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B. Halase

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Vulcan 800
customer_reviews.text: Easily lifted the bike. I had to use wood blocks to keep the plate from crushing cables that run under the frame. Other than that, no issues. I left the bike on the stand for a week and it didn't budge.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jack, check weight specs..
customer_reviews.text: Whatch the weight spec.Amazon says that it can hold 1000lbs - 1200lbs but when I opened the package and read the manual is says capacity 1000lbs, and says " The maximum bike weight is 450kg, DO NOT exceed this rated capicity" which is 992lbs, not a big deal for me but just be aware if your bike is over 1000lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Napsey

customer_reviews.title: Great lift for the money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome center lift. Lifted my 1996 Vulcan 800 no problem (520-550lbs I'm guessing). For anybody with a Vulcan- you need to get two 2x4's and cut them roughly 6" long so it hits the frame rails because the engine hangs down below. My only gripe with this product is that the 22mm socket they provide doesn't have any leverage, but it's easy enough to use your own.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Its definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.text: I admit I was very hesitant to buy this lift but I gotta say it surpassed my expectations. Dont get me wrong, it's not rock solid out of the box. But a strap or two later or some jack stands for extra support and you're ready to go! Lifted a 2007 kawasaki Vulcan 1600 classic with saddle bags and plenty of extras.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: best jack for the price
customer_reviews.text: it is solid and sturdy up to 3/4 of the way expanded, then it gets a little wobbly. but overall its a great jack.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you grease or oil the all threads including the ball bearings behind the nut... Don’t use an impact wrench! Just turn but by hand with a socket and it works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Lejoe B Young

customer_reviews.title: way better than the foot stomping "lever" type with one wimpy ...
customer_reviews.text: very stable. I do put a yoga pad under it when wrenching, cause no rubber mat on the bottom. Smooth mechanics for raising and lowering, way better than the foot stomping "lever" type with one wimpy center post. I put a 2009 KLX250s on it and bust nuts loose. It's good.
customer_reviews.author: TWM

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, sturdy, heavy duty stand. It lifts and holds my Sportster up, no problem. I like the rubber pad on the top. Its bigger than it seems in the pictures and very stable. I should have bought something like this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rugg

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to operate hand crank
customer_reviews.text: Really well made, but the little hand crank makes it difficult to lift anything close to a couple of hundred pounds. Might work best with an air gun or impact wrench, but I had to return
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: Love my scissor lift! It has allowed me to do maintainece on my bike AND add stability when transporting my bike. Very stable and sturdy, also budget friendly. Only damage to mine is some torn rubber and minor scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Purchased after reading other reviews and was not disappointed. Already knew about using a ratchet in place of the little tool it comes with so cannot count that against it. This was sturdy and easily lifted my Honda Shadow Ace - not a huge bike (500lbs dry weight). Bike was steady the entire time. Really like how easy it is to store, tuck next to work bench and out of the way when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Was nice while it lasted....
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in Feb ‘19 and other than the wrench they supplied not providing enough leverage to raise either of my heavy cruisers, it worked well and did the job. But in March of this year, the thrust washer and bearing set at the drive screw shattered while lifting a bike. Now the thing is useless and I’m looking for replacement parts and/or a new scissor lift. My only other issue with it is that it’s about 1 1/2” too wide for my liking. But that is just a person preference.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April 2020. Broke yesterday, June 2020 while turning the jack down. Bolt that you turn to raise or lower snapped off and barring inside feel apart. I looked for a way to contact the company directly. There's nothing on their business page for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ysoserious

customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my bike on here 4-5 times to work on it. Works as it should, but 3 stars because the rubber pad on top is already getting pretty torn up
customer_reviews.author: Max B.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal does what it needs to.
customer_reviews.text: First time using it. It does what it was ment for. Lifts up and down with relatively no effort with 2003 Honda shadow. I did have to use a couple 2x4 to make it work because of the thermostat housing hangs below the frame
customer_reviews.author: Ironwarrior883

customer_reviews.title: Good little jack
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, you can tell is more cheaply made than others but when holding up a 700lb Harley it performs exactly like the other brands
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jack For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice jack. I purchased it for my Honda Shadow VT750. It seems to lift just fine and it's pretty sturdy for doing things like oil changes and chain maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Yingling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lift for small projects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lift to aid with installing rear shocks on a Road Glide. There were no issues with balance, steadiness or weight restrictions. Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joey E. Trude

customer_reviews.title: Good lift, just use your own handle
customer_reviews.text: I should drop a star for one reason... the supplied socket to operate the lift has too small of a bolt/handle. The best option is a 7/8” socket & ratchet, or a ratcheting dogbone. Most importantly, the jack worked well on my ‘05 H-D Electra Glide (800+ lbs.). Bike remained steady.
customer_reviews.author: craig marchionda

customer_reviews.title: THIS ITEM WORKS PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact design, easy to store and handle. It will fit under my bike easily with the side stand down, and then jacking up the bike is very easy and safe. I like it much better than the traditional big bulky bike jack
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: the appearance of the motorcycle sissor lift jack flat stand hoist /socket.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size and weight of the Jack. It was what I wanted to make a adjustable carving table. What I did not like was the top and bottom did not line up. I would prefer that the ends would not be off set. Thanks for asking about your tool.
customer_reviews.author: LD Palk  retired

customer_reviews.title: it works, and durability
customer_reviews.text: This item received in good condition. Working fine, hope that it can last long enough
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Chua

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, well built with light rubber cushion that comes in contact with motorcycle frame, cranks up and down smoothly. Now put away until next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B.

customer_reviews.title: A must have! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: A must have if you wrench on your own bike. Fits nicely under my 17 Street Glide Special. Perfect for changing the oil, cleaning the wheels and even for storing the bike upright.
customer_reviews.author: jlasersmith

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and works
customer_reviews.text: used this to change the tires on my suzuki s40, worked perfectly. with the bike in the air i had almost no movement from the jack and it easily lifted up with the supplied handle. way better then i expected for the money.
customer_reviews.author: inflateable jesus

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: After lifting my bike 2 times, the nut for the handle snapped off. Dropping my bike to the ground. Luckily the kickstand was still out and only caused minor damage. Keeping in mind this is supposed to be rated for 1200lbs and my 1977 harley davidson is only around 850 with full fuel. Definitely not buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good lift
customer_reviews.text: Had my Kawasaki Vulcan on this thing for a month with no issues
customer_reviews.author: D. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: The whole jack would flex when lifting bike. Ended up breaking the jack screw bearing after one use. Only thing I was pleased with was the return process.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Shuck

customer_reviews.title: Almost dropped my bike!
customer_reviews.text: This jack worked fine until today. I was letting my bike down and something on the jack gave sending my bike to the ground very quickly to my surprise. Glad I was coming down and not up.
customer_reviews.author: Derek H.

customer_reviews.title: Great lift for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Slides under my Heritage Classic just fine and lifts the perfect working height. Lift is sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Can lift a sportster with a 190lb guy sitting on it no problem. Packs away nicely due to it's small form factor. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Imperio

customer_reviews.title: You will use it more than you know!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for detailing bike. Or had to replace starter on Big dog pretty good tear down did what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Barebones and very simple.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. My only gripe is that the handle is finicky and could be designed better. It's a basic cranking system with a bolt as a handle. The said bolt moves around too easily and is not ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: MHJamesLeung

customer_reviews.title: I really like the smaller size of this unit vs
customer_reviews.text: I really like the smaller size of this unit vs. the larger hydraulic jack I had previously. It's stable, raises and lowers quickly, and operation is smooth. I have a skid plate under my (1" lifted) KLR650, and it works perfectly with my bike. I would highly recommend this lift.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Dynas
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Incredibly simple right out of the box. No installation or anything, it’s just ready to go. I used it to lift my 2016 Dyna street bob to remove the forks/rear tire. The platform is wider than my frame and didn’t lose any height when left jacked up for 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, very stable. Just opened and used on my 13 Harley Electra Glide without issue, just be sure to find a good spot on the frame rails to lift.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing but I haven’t used it on a motorcycle. Worked great for lowering the fuel tank on my jeep since it was full of fuel. I also used it to hold up some heavy side rails as I bolted them down.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Junk!!! Isn’t going to be good for any kind of stability. My bike almost fell on top of me.. I went back to using my car jack with a 4x4 if that doesn’t explain.
customer_reviews.author: adam p.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Jack was not able to do more than two lifts. The screw and bolt both stripped out when I jacked up my Road King. Could not handle the load. VERY DISSATISFIED.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V. Cebek

customer_reviews.title: It's a well-made product
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a good product, well built, I use this product to change the tires on my 2005 Electra glide classic. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd have to really crank it to get the bike up, but it still turns surprisingly easily when the weight of the bike is on it. It simply does what it is designed to do and I can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: ThePorge

customer_reviews.title: Good Flat Jack
customer_reviews.text: So far. Indian cheifton. No issues. I’ve been told it’s to thick to fit under some bikes. So far so good. It’s a flat jack the rubber won’t last, don’t care. Good flat jack
customer_reviews.author: Kno Juan

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product - heavy duty - lifts my BMW GS no problem. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Markluke

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle lift
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for getting under the frame of my Vrod as it sits very low.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Gunz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This Jack is really solid. Does the job, only wish it had a better ball bearing. Definitely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, quality construction. A bit pricey but worth it to have it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Treanor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very sturdy with a heavy bagger!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product I love it ! Went right to work after I got it put a 21 inch wheel on the bike and lowered the rear 2 inches ! Thanks for such a great product
customer_reviews.author: Tom Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you would expect for the money. I was able to get the Vulcan 900 off the ground so I could get the front wheel off and put a new tire on. Mission accomplished
customer_reviews.author: Bad bitch

customer_reviews.title: Stable, easy to use, durable and doesn't make me worry about scuffing the underside of my bike!
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward to use and very stable. I use it with my 2018 Zero SR and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good size. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. I’d love to buy a second one just to use two at once and keep the bike even more stable for bigger jobs. But overall works great especially for the size. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Mason Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my motorcycle. It fits perfectly under my bike so I can drain the oil. It also fits under my workbench.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great lift
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great, and you don't have to worry about the hydraulics failing. Only way to improve is put a heavier (thicker) mat on the top. Great unit. good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This jack gets the job done, it's a touch wobbly but secure enough for me to trust with a CB500X on it. It also had some glue on the rubber top and the box was pretty beat up when I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander C Marsh

product_meta.title: Orion Motor Tech Dilated Scissor Lift Jack for Street Bike, Cruiser, Adventure Touring Motorcycle
feature_bullets: 1,000 ~ 1,200 lbs scissor lift jack for motorcycles with flat bottom. The load bearing will be bigger if the contact surface is larger.
Lift Range: 3-3/4 in. to 13-2/5 in, come with an easy operate sleeve(steel).
Platform Dimensions: 9-4/5 in.(L) x 15-3/4 in.(W), safe rubber wide deck.
Durable heavy duty steel body, easy cleanup paint (oil-, grease- and dirt-resistant).
Avoid using an impact wrench; improper usage may cause damage to nut, lift a motorcycle easily by rotating the metal sleeve, instruction included.

specifications.Special Features: 1200lb load capacity, Anti-slip, Safe, Low slim-fit design
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars736 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
